intro: Staphisagria brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking violet-blue flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Staphisagria brevipes is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a characteristic species of dry, sunny environments.
